input.description: The name of the adapter to use to handle the request. Default adapter name: InfobloxNIOS.

Creates a new Host Record in Infoblox Grid Manager.
Sample items Xml:
<items> <item> <target> <host>localhost</host> <user-name>admin</user-name> <password encryption-type="Base64">YWRtaW4=</password> <timeout-secs>120</timeout-secs> </target> <parameters> <ipv4-hosts></ipv4-hosts> <name></name> <zone></zone> <aliases></aliases> <comment></comment> <disable></disable> <configure-for-dns></configure-for-dns> <dns-view></dns-view> <network-view></network-view> <scheduled-at>2012-11-29T18:30:19+05:30</scheduled-at> <extensible-attributes> <attribute> <key></key> <value></value> </attribute> </extensible-attributes> <ipv6-hosts></ipv6-hosts> </parameters> </item> </items>
Elements' Description:
target[Conditional]:
host[Conditional]: Host name or IP address of Infoblox Grid Manager. This tag is required while providing dynamic targets.
user-name[Conditional]: Username required to connect Infoblox Grid Manager. This tag is required while providing dynamic targets.
password[Conditional]: The password associated with the <user-name> provided. Encrypted password can be provided by providing an "encryption-type" attribute. This tag is required while providing dynamic targets. Valid values for encryption-type are: Plain, Base64 Default value: Plain
timeout-secs[Optional] Specifies the time, in seconds, after which the attempt to connect to the Infoblox Grid Manager fails. Default value in seconds: 60
Note: If no adapter configurations are specified while configuring the adapter dynamic target need to be defined under "target" tag.
ipv4-hosts[Conditional] Specify the IPv4 address for which host record will be created. Note: It can contain multiple entries sperated by comma. e.g. 10.0.0.1,10.0.0.2 Condition : Required if ipv6-hosts is not provided.
name[Required] Specify the host name.
zone[Conditional] Specify the zone for which this host record will be created. Note: It must be a valid zone in Infoblox Grid Manager. Condition : Required if configure-for-dns is set to true.
aliases[Optional] Specify the aliases for the host record. Note: It can contains multiple entries seprated by comma. e.g. host1,host2,host3.
ipv6-hosts[Conditional] Specify the IPv6 address for which host record will be created. Note: It can contain multiple entries sperated by comma. e.g. 2001:a000::0000,2001:b000::0000 Condition : Required if ipv4-hosts is not provided.
disable[Optional] Specify the value for disable flag. Valid Values are true, false [default]
configure-for-dns[Optional] Specify the value for dns flag. Valid Values are false, true [default]
comment[Optional] Specify the user comment for the network.
extensible-attributes[Optional] Specify the extensible attributes for the network. E.g. Building, site etc.
network-view[Conditional] The network view in which the host record will be created. By default "default" network-view will be used. Required if you want to create record in custom nework-view
dns-view[Conditional] The DNS view in which the host record is created. By default, "default" DNS view will be used. Required if you want to create record in custom nework-view
scheduled-at[Optional] Specify the date time on which operation need to be executed. Date and time are represented in ISO 8601 extended format (e.g., 2008-10-21T10:56:00Z or 2008-10-21T10:56:00.001Z) with some restrictions. When the scheduling parameter is used, changes do not occur immediately. Instead at the date time specified in this parameter.
